title: CI builds for macOS app M1

labels.name: priority F0: urgent
labels.description: Feature that has to be implemented & released ASAP for strong urgent reasons (likely a rare tag to u

body:
## Description

<!-- Provide a short description describing the problem you are experiencing. -->
We've added support for arm64 builds in this PR https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/pull/9869
The app can be compiled natively on M1 chips following these steps:
1. `make clean`
2. `brew install qt@5`
3. update `QTDIR` and `PATH` and point to a Qt installation for arm64
4. `make`

The next step is to add the M1 builds in the CI process and to be able to release them.
When do we need this?

@John-44 @iurimatias 

> When do we need this?

> @John-44 @iurimatias
> 
> > When do we need this?

Ideally, it would be great if we could have an OSX ARM build of 0.11 that folks could download, because the biggest issue so far with dogfooding is Status Desktop's performance, which is particularly bad on OSX ARM hardware today.  For Mac users, native Apple ARM builds give a good perf. improvement.

So re. when do we need this, the 0.11 target release date is Friday 7th April.   So (if possible) it would be great to have this by Friday 7th April at the very latest (and slightly earlier than this would be better of course).

I'm back from holidays on the 3rd. This in THEORY should be simple, so I can probably make that deadline.

Probably.

One matter is that the setup script for MacOS hosts needs support for ARM64 Qt:
https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/blob/3008e56455bfae838105dc8f2bc11f9db62d9a32/scripts/macos_build_setup.sh#L26
But we already have it covered for Go:
https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/blob/3008e56455bfae838105dc8f2bc11f9db62d9a32/scripts/macos_build_setup.sh#L43-L47

But it appears that the only Qt architecture available via `aqtinstall` is:
```
 > aqt list-qt mac desktop --arch 5.15.2
clang_64 wasm_32
```
Not sure if that matters for this case. It could cover ARM64 too.
@alexjba did you not have to install Qt via some other method instead of `aqt` to make this work on M1? Or does that work fine?

There's at least one issue with our `scripts/macos_build_setup.sh` script:
```
ERROR   : [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/usr/local/qt'
```
We need to use a different path on M1 hosts. Probably `/opt`.

> @alexjba did you not have to install Qt via some other method instead of `aqt` to make this work on M1? Or does that work fine?

`brew install qt@5` will install the arm version. `aqt` does not provide an arm build

That's not really a solution.
We need to pin a specific version of Qt so we don't get hard to debug issues die to version mismatches.

The `qt@5` version is actually `5.15.8`, which is different from the `5.15.2` we use:
https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/blob/fdd37018b9a77ae893b86f8d24d0934f42f1a33b/Formula/qt%405.rb#L6

So that's an issue. This will not be simple.

> The `qt@5` version is actually `5.15.8`, which is different from the `5.15.2` we use: https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/blob/fdd37018b9a77ae893b86f8d24d0934f42f1a33b/Formula/qt%405.rb#L6
> 
> So that's an issue. This will not be simple.

Can't we actually use 5.15.8 for both archs on macOS?
That's a good question, I don't know. Can we? I have no idea how big the differences are, I've never used Qt for anything.
Heck, we could even use the brew Qt5 build for Linux (sorry Windows users :)

Although the other issue is that even if we do switch to `5.15.8` we cannot rely on Brew to provide exactly the same version forever.

EDIT: Though in theory I think you can provide an exact formulae file to brew, but I haven't tried.

> Although the other issue is that even if we do switch to `5.15.8` we cannot rely on Brew to provide exactly the same version forever.
> 

That should not be a problem, all 5.15.x are binary/backwards compatible

>brew Qt5 build for Linux

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2212681/227037262-ec1c8f5d-3efb-4231-bfde-8f2178a2f43a.png)
on linux we're stuck on Qt5.15.2 because of the glibc version. Migrating to a brew installation of qt5.15.8 means to upgrade the minimum requirements on linux.

God, I wish I could just use Nix. It would work, also on macOS, but that glibc nonsense it blocking that.

Unless we successfully used [a glibc verison hack](https://github.com/wheybags/glibc_version_header), but I never had the time to try to make it work.

> > The `qt@5` version is actually `5.15.8`, which is different from the `5.15.2` we use: https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/blob/fdd37018b9a77ae893b86f8d24d0934f42f1a33b/Formula/qt%405.rb#L6
> > So that's an issue. This will not be simple.
> 
> Can't we actually use 5.15.8 for both archs on macOS?

This is a good option IMO

Well, if we are confident about higher minor verisons of `5.15.x` being fine for macOS then we can use that solution.

But I probably can't implement this until I'm back from my ski trip on the 3rd of April.

We could easily use Nix for macOS builds on both architectures. Nixpkgs already has `5.15.8`:
https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/blob/98df3b1874578b41650528a63827412e8c960875/pkgs/development/libraries/qt-5/5.15/srcs.nix#L4

And I do have a branch with a `shell.nix` ready:
https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/blob/9bdd84cd20abef628d9f7eccdb817e728c986646/shell.nix#L1-L40
I'd rather use it for all builds, but we could use it just for macOS for now.
Yeah, either use Nix or brew to get the ARM support, it doesn't matter we'll have a greater minor version there (5.15.8 vs 5.15.2 elsewhere; I'm running 5.15.8 locally too on Linux)

What the hell happened here? Why do we have two `vendor` locations?
https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/blob/9af1734c6a62d80b68445b071bab984c43ada2f5/.gitmodules#L117-L119

> What the hell happened here? Why do we have two `vendor` locations?
> 
> https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/blob/9af1734c6a62d80b68445b071bab984c43ada2f5/.gitmodules#L117-L119

It's just a submodule of StatusQ; @igor-sirotin

It's doing weird things...
```
 > git submodule update --init --recursive
error: submodule git dir '/home/jakubgs/work/status-desktop/.git/modules/ui/StatusQ/vendor/qzxing' is inside git dir '/home/jakubgs/work/status-desktop/.git/modules/ui/StatusQ'
fatal: refusing to create/use '/home/jakubgs/work/status-desktop/.git/modules/ui/StatusQ/vendor/qzxing' in another submodule's git dir
Failed to clone 'ui/StatusQ/vendor/qzxing'. Retry scheduled
error: submodule git dir '/home/jakubgs/work/status-desktop/.git/modules/ui/StatusQ/vendor/qzxing' is inside git dir '/home/jakubgs/work/status-desktop/.git/modules/ui/StatusQ'
fatal: refusing to create/use '/home/jakubgs/work/status-desktop/.git/modules/ui/StatusQ/vendor/qzxing' in another submodule's git dir
Failed to clone 'ui/StatusQ/vendor/qzxing' a second time, aborting
```

Wtf:
https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/blob/9af1734c6a62d80b68445b071bab984c43ada2f5/.gitmodules#L111-L113
This is clearly wrong.

What is happening here...
```
 > grep SortFilterProxyModel .gitmodules   
[submodule "vendor/SortFilterProxyModel"]
	path = ui/StatusQ/vendor/SortFilterProxyModel
	url = https://github.com/status-im/SortFilterProxyModel.git

 > cat ui/StatusQ/.gitmodules
[submodule "vendor/SortFilterProxyModel"]
	path = vendor/SortFilterProxyModel
	url = https://github.com/status-im/SortFilterProxyModel.git
```
Why would there be tro `.gitmodules` files with the same entry.
I think those are leftovers from when StatusQ used to be a submodule itself too; does this happen on a fresh checkout?
Classic yak shaving. I work on one thing and discover some completely unrelated chaos that needs fixing.
